comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: There was a John K. Clark who was an assistant district attorney in NYC in this time frame. He's mentioned here query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F20816FA3F5A15... and has a couple of other Google hits. All the books and papers look like this is a lawyer's office.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: His full name was John Kirkland Clark. Perhaps he was running for a higher office at the time these pictures were taken and circulated to Bain's subscribers?

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thank you rjones0856,  Wystan and Richard Arthur Norton for the information about  attorney John Kirkland Clark.  According to the New York Times (Feb. 17, 1914) Clark was appointed counsel to the Assembly Graft Investigating Committee. This image is dated March 16, 1914 based on the date on the related negative seen above. We will add some of this information to the record when we update.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry for him in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Kirkland_Clark
